  • 字段详细资料

    • fmt

      public static final Grisu fmt
      The default formatter with 16 max_int_digits, 10 max_frac_digits, and using little 'e' for the exp_char.

    • max_int_digits

      public final int max_int_digits

    • max_frac_digits

      public final int max_frac_digits

    • exp_char

      public final byte exp_char

    • longest_double_output

      public static final int longest_double_output
      The longest printed representation is 24. As long as max_int_digits is less than 17 this holds, plus 1 for minus sign, plus 1 for the decimal point, plus 5 for the exponent (+/-, e, 3 digits).
      另请参阅:
      • 常量字段值

  • 方法详细资料

    • doubleToString

      public String doubleToString(double value)
      Prints the double floating point value into a #String. Underneath it calls doubleToBytes(byte[], int, double) with a newly allocated temporary buffer and then news off a String from that.
      参数:
      value - The double value
      返回:
      The printed representation

    • toChars

      protected static char[] toChars(io.edap.util.Grisu.ByteArray buf, int len)

    • doubleToBytes

      public int doubleToBytes(byte[] buffer, int boffset, double value)
      Will print the specific double value to the buffer starting at offset using the Grisu2 algorithm described by Florian Loitsch in Printing Floating-Point Numbers Quickly and Accurately with Integers. It gives the shortest correct result that will round trip about 99.8% of the time and a correct one, but not the shortest, the rest of the time.

      No garbage is generate in the call.

      参数:
      buffer - A buffer that has at least 24 more bytes allocated. This isn't checked so you can get away with less, if you are sure if will fit.
      boffset - Where to begin writing.

    • u_quickpath

    • formatBuffer

      protected int formatBuffer(byte[] buffer, int boffset, int blen, int exp)
      Grisu just gives you a string of numbers and a base 10 exponent. This makes it easier to read (e.g, 0.1 isn't rendered as 1 * 10^-1) This is conceptually simple, but intricate in practice, especially when trying to write into a buffer at a offset. This only write positive values. It is assumed the negative sign will be taken care of elsewhere. returns the final length of the formatted number
      参数:
      buffer - The buffer #u_grisu2(byte[], int, double) printed into.
      boffset - The start position of the digits. The same argument to #u_grisu2(byte[], int, double).
      blen - The length of the digit string returned from #u_grisu2(byte[], int, double)
      exp - The exponent returned from #u_grisu2(byte[], int, double)
      返回:
      The final length of the formatted number
